result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Richard Allen Achenbach was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

Conditions:  

14 days conditional jail time to be served at a time determined by the agent.  Jail may be served in any Wisconsin county that will accept.

Pay a total fine with costs in the amount of $2072.  Agent to refer to the Assessment Report for a breakdown.

Do not possess or consume alcohol.  Submit to testing of blood, breath or urine to monitor compliance.

Submit a DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before signing up for probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
* JOC amended regarding costs:  Costs include $200 DNA surcharge and $66 blood draw cost, payable to Richland County Sheriff's Department.

timeConds.notes: With work release.  May be served in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept.  Agent to determine when this time is served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Allen Achenbach

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Allen Achenbach in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. L states that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution - def to plead to OWI 3rd for probation treatment option.  Def pleads guilty to OWI 3rd.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.

155 days jail imposed/stayed for probation of 1 year with conditions to include 14 days conditional time (to be served at a time determined by the agent).  Fine total $2072.  33 mo revocation.  33 mo IID upon relicensing.  AODA/driver safety plan.  No to possess/consume alcohol; submit to testing to monitor compliance.  Submit DNA sample at RCSD before signing up for probation.  Conditional jail time may be served in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept.  $66 blood draw rest. due to Richland County.

Defendant Richard Allen Achenbach not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court, by authorization, for Defendant Richard Allen Achenbach.  Atty. L states def has been in trtmt facility; asks for adjournment 4-6 weeks out.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Richard Allen Achenbach not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court for Defendant Richard Allen Achenbach, by authorization.  Atty. L states def is presently in a treatment facility; asks for adjournment of this matter.  NG plea entered.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Richard Allen Achenbach in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Charges stated.  Court notes message from SPD that def does not qualify for SPD.  Court questions def to determine if def is eligible for Dean counsel.  5/15 at 1:30 for adj. initial.  Court has instructed def to contact criminal legal clinic (brochure provided).  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
